text: A BRILLIANT NIGHT SKY. Cloudless and pure with a dazzling array of stars. BURNING EMBERS drift upwards followed by tongues of FIRE reaching into the blackness. Then the SOUND of FEROCIOUS COMBAT rises. Swords clashing pistols roaring along with the cries of the dying. The stars and embers are suddenly replaced by THE FACE OF FIERCE WARRIOR. He screams a ferocious challenge. There’s murder in his eyes as... ...he raises a vicious scimitar, it catches the light of the fires nearby and he... HAS A HOLE BLOWN THROUGH HIS HEAD. As the victim collapses out of frame we see the killer still holding his two smoking MATCHLOCK PISTOLS - this is SOLOMON KANE, swordsman, Naval Captain, mercenary, buccaneer and servant of the Queen of England. He turns t the MEN following him.

No mercy to heathens! Advance! ! He smoothly holsters his pistols and unsheathes his two signature swords - a CUTLASS and a RAPIER. He deflects a flurry of attacks from his enemies and cuts them down without a thought. It is obvious he is a martia expert with these weapons as he drives forward. SOLOMON KANE is in his early thirties but it’s hard tell through the history of violence and adventure which has weathered his face. He’s masculine but wolf slim with lon dark hair tied back, intense, predatory eyes and pale ski now spattered in the blood of his victims. He’s dressed i ornate, expensive clothes where, somewhere beneath all th finery is the uniform of a Captain in the Queens Navy. Wi the trims and excess of his own choosing he looks unique and exotic - a murderous dandy. Kane hacks at another of the city’s defenders. Sidesteps yet another sweeping scimitar and delivers death with eve thrust of his rapier. He is unstoppable.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 2 At his back Kane’s own PLATOON OF MARINES follow. Equally relentless and bloodthirsty as their commander are a wedg of PIKEMEN, ARCHERS and SWORDSMEN driving further and further into the city’s defences. Further behind still, is the SEA PORT where they entered this glittering, exotic and magical city where an ENGLISH NAVAL TALL SHIP is moored. The HARBOUR and MUCH OF THE CI BY THE SHORE IS BURNING FIERCELY. The path of destruction and fire is like a wake left behind by Kane’s advance. The whole city seems to be in a panic. WOMAN and CHILDREN screaming in fear, MEN rushing to defend their homes, NATIVE WARRIORS launching attacks on Kane’s soldiers but nothing seems to be able to stop them. One of KANE’S OWN MEN rushes past him, fleeing from a MOB of the city’s defenders. Kane pulls a pistol, takes aim.. He SHOOTS HIS OWN MAN IN THE BACK. The man crashes to the ground, screaming as a dozen scimitar blades hack him to pieces.
(under his breath) Faithless coward. Kane, sweating and blood-spattered, dashes forward, eyes gleaming.

On-me men! See; there’s our goal! Perched on the cliff overlooking the city is a CASTLE OF BLACK OBSIDIAN. Almost organic in its lines and architecture it sits impassive; a careless guardian of th burning city beneath. A handful of his men make it to his side. Fighting all th way. One, LIEUTENANT MALTHUS, at Kane’s shoulder.
Captain, what about the prisoners we’re supposed to rescue?
Malthus; you take care of that.
What are you going to do Captain? Kane grins like a wolf.
I have a different prize in mind. Cooper! COOPER, a great brute of a man fights his way towards Kan  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 3
Send half the men with Malthus.
And the rest?
See that black tower ahead?
Aye.
It’s the one the slave girl told us about.
You don’t believe her Solomon? She would have said anything to save herself. There’s no fortune to be had.
Perhaps but I’1l be long dead before I pass up a chance like this.
Is that the real reason we came to this barbarian place Captain; just to line your pockets further? Kane laughs even as they both stop to fight off a FRESH WAVE OF ATTACKERS.
You have no ambition Malthus; that’s your principal failing.
At least I know the difference between good and evil.
Which is why you will never have the riches or power that I have. Now follow your orders!

DOZENS OF DEFENDING CASTLE GUARDS are slamming the heavy main doors and barricading them. Holding the wooden bar i place as...  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 4 More and more SOLDIERS push in to defend. All marshalled the inner doors of the obsidian castle, they are heavily armed, disciplined and eager for a fight But SUDDENLY those doors SMASH INWARDS with a HUGE EXPLOSION of fire and gunpowder that TEARS THE HEAVY DOOR OFF THEIR HINGES. The SOLDIERS ARE BLOWN APART. The lucky ones are flung aside by the blast as a VORTEX OF FLAME howls down the hallway - tapestries, artwork and people all engulfed in the inferno. The GUARDS lie dead or dying. A wall of flame burns in th doorway. A FIGURE walks through the flames, leading a DOZEN MEN. He moves like a wolf, focussed and deadly. Long hair flying, black cloak whipped by the hot air and intense da eyes scanning the dead. This is SOLOMON KANE. Kane stops before one of the cowering GUARDS and levels h pistol at the man.

Where is the throne room? He repeats the line in the native language, aggressive, commanding. The man shields his face and points, indicating the direction and spitting out instructions. KANE takes in the information and then SHOOTS THE MAN, POINT BLANK.
(to his men) This way! As KANE leads HIS DOZEN MEN further into the castle, he shoots and stabs every last one of the defenders. KANE SLAUGHTERS EVERY SURVIVOR. No one is spared.

KANE and his MEN pass through inner doors and advance cautiously into the heart of the castle. There’s no further resistance now but no one is lowering their guard They enter a huge room filled with columns between which hang VAST BLACK MIRRORS. There are strange symbols etched into the surface - magical and ornate, rich in meaning.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 5
What is this place?
We shouldn’t be here. Can’t you feel it? One of the soldier’s turns sharply.
There’s something in here with us.

(hissing to his men) Quiet! Keep moving. The other soldiers look around nervously but there’s nowhere for anything to hide. Kane studies his own reflection as he passes a mirror. In the surface he sees SOMETHING BEHIND HIM. He whirls round to confront his enemy but THERE IS NOTHING THERE apart fr an infinity of his own image caught between mirrors on th opposite wall. A little unnerved he advances. His men follow. As the last few men begin to move on again DARK FIGURES

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY REACH OUT FROM WITHIN THE MIRRORS. BLACK SKELETA

text: ARMS EMBRACE KANE’S MEN. With muffled screams HALF OF THE SOLDIERS vanish, dragged back through the now liquid glass by the demons within. The doors of the corridor SLAM SHUT BEHIND THE OTHERS. Th remaining men start to panic. Swords and pistols at the ready but no enemy in sight. One sees his companion falli backwards into the darkness of the mirror...
Captain...!
Hold steady.
There is devilry, I know it. Kane grabs the man, snarling.
I am the only devil here. Now move! Now the DOORS AHEAD OF THEM SWING OPEN.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 6 An invitation to advance into...
KANE strides eagerly across the threshold into the THRONE ROOM. A cavernous, ornate space filled with grotesque statues of twisted figures caught in helpless agony.

This is it lads. We’ve found it. He turns to his men - just as the throne room doors SLAM SHUT BEHIND HIM, cutting him off from his companions. He tries to tear the heavy doors open but they will not move There are no handles, no way to escape. He can hear SCREAMS from beyond the doors. A few brief moments of terror, one or two GUNSHOTS and cries of pain and then nothing but SILENCE. He turns back to the throne room and looks about him. Little light filters through the stained glass windows bu just enough to illuminate... ...the TREASURE piled around a vast, high-backed, black THRONE on a raised dais ahead. VAST WEALTH laid casually about in glittering mounds. Unafraid Kane steps further into the throne room. It seem deserted but he is ready with his weapons.

Show yourself! Or shall I take your treasure unopposed? Still nothing. Kane moves slowly forwards. He reaches dow to pick up some of the treasures then notices THE CORPSE THE KING lying beside his throne. Kane is suddenly unsure He whirls around to confront a sound but there is no one there.

Show yourself!! You should... He stops in mid sentence, unnerved, as THE SHADOWS AROUND THE ROOM SEEM TO MOVE AND TWIST before him. The air in the room freezes, his breath billows around hi clouds now. A CRACKING, BREAKING SOUND echoes around the room as ICE TENDRILS BEGIN TO SNAKE ACROSS the floor, towards the THRONE.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 7 FINGERS OF SMOKE AND SHADOW twist a whirl on the throne a little by little a SHAPE APPEARS. A FIGURE seemingly CLOTHED in BLACK SHADOWS that shift an change around him. It must be a man but it is so hard to see beyond the darkness that envelopes him. For fleeting, heart-stopping moments, the darkness takes form - somethi awful and corrupt - before becoming hazy and indistinct once again. Then the figure speaks. The voice seems to be coming from the very air itself. Powerful, resonant, insidious and beguiling. This is the Devil’s Reaper.
Solomon Kane. Soldier, pirate thief, warrior... murderer. Kane holds his ground but knows he’s in trouble.
You think I have not met sorcerers in my travels? I have no fear of you. A subsonic rumble fills the room. Kane says he has no fea but he’s growing nervous now.
I am no mere sorcerer Kane. You know me. You know my master. He is your master too.
I have no master save the Queen. I ama...

It is a shattering sound. The power drives Kane to his knees. A darkness swallows the room for a moment and when it passes, there are low MOANS OF PAIN coming from all aroun the throne room. Kane sees in the gloomy half-light FIGURES HANGING FROM THE WALLS. His MEN, CRUCIFIED, FLAYED, IMPALED all around. The REAPER RISES and slowly advances on Kane. He moves wi a savage, predatory grace. Beautiful and menacing.
Your time is over Kane. Your deal is done. I have been sent to claim His prize.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 8
I made no deal.
When you killed your first innocent in greed and lust; you made your pact with Him. Kane struggles to his feet again.
I am a soldier. I killed only...
Once more the sound is like a hammer blow, knocking Kane his hands and knees.
You are a butcher! Revelling in the fear and torment you brought with you!
(quietly) No...

And were you not rewarded? With power? With wealth? with fame? Everything you desired. As the spectre finally stands over him, Kane looks up and stares into the abyss of the shadow’s face; there are burning eyes deep within, a ghastly predatory face that shifts and twists with each word.
You know who I serve? Kane tries to catch his breath. His world is spinning as realises just what he is facing.
You... you cannot take my soul.
You have already lost it. Bow your head before me! Kane sees now, in the Demon’s hand, A SWORD. A blade of seething molten metal. Runes and patterns flow across its surface.

You are damned.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 9 Defeated, Kane does, slowly, bow his head. The Reaper raises the sword above him, preparing to strike the death blow. It sweeps down with incredible force only to be met by... ...KANE’S TWO SWORDS BLOCKING its path. Kane rises to his feet. Teeth gritted, eyes blazing.
Tell your master I will not be going to Hell. Even in the face of this pure evil Kane will not be defeated. He stares into the abyss once more; unflinching though still full of fear now.
The Lord protects me. Kane paries another sweeping thrusts but the burning blad slices through his rapier.

Fool! He does not want you. You are damned. Kane blocks a return thrust which destroys his cutlass. Unarmed now, Kane slowly backs away as the Reaper advance on him again. There’s nowhere for him to go...
On your knees!

Never! I will never give myself to you! Kane charges at the HUGE STAINED GLASS WINDOW and smashes through an image of Demons and Angels, locked in eternal conflict. The glass shatters, revealing the burning city and the night sky beyond but nothing below apart from the sea crashing onto jagged rocks hundreds of feet beneath. With a desolate cry, Kane plummets down into the void wit the words of the Devil ringing in his ears.
You cannot escape us. Wherever you go, we will find you...Your soul is lost.
Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 19 A TERRIBLE SCREAM against the blackness.
An ISOLATED GREY STONE MONASTERY on a windswept hillside. The first pale splashes of a chill, silver dawn bring little hope for the day to come.
TwO MONKS in their heavy hooded robes carry a tray of wat and bread along the cloisters of an open courtyard. Their breath steams around them. Other MONKS go silently about their business.
How long has he been here?
Nearly a year.
A year? Master, I do not understand why we serve this man.
We do not serve him. He sought sanctuary here and that is what we offer. Are you, a novice, to judge him? They stop outside a door.
I hear his screams in the night.
We all do. You might scream too if you’d seen what he has.
(awed) Then what they say about him is true. The older monk casts a withering eye on the novice.
What do they say Thomas?  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett an A nervous pause. The young monk is not sure he should eve say this out loud.
That... he met... that... Satan himself came for his soul but he would not relinquish it. That his body is marked with runes and spells to keep him from the sight of the Dark One.

A lesser man would be out of his mind by now but Kane... he is unlike any other. The older monk knocks on Kane’s door. INT. KANE’S MONASTIC CELL - CONT 8 The KNOCK on Kane’s door is followed by a gentle creaking as it opens slowly. The two monks respectfully enter the gloomy room as Kane remains silent but watchful in his co
Solomon? A voice comes from a dark corner.
Brother Fletcher; how does the day find you?
As the Lord intended; cold of bone and stiff of joint. We have a little breakfast for you.
Who is this novice?

He joined us only a few days ago. Kane levers himself to the edge of his bed and into the flickering amber light of a candle. The Kane of now is a man of small gestures and quiet, almost diffident talk - the brash, aggressive buccaneer of before has long since vanished. He has aged. His hair is longer, a stubbly bear is flecked with grey hair. His eyes are haunted. The YOUNG NOVICE draws breath sharply as he notices Kane’ NAKED TORSO. Kane’s' body has been marked with elaborate cuts and tattoos. Some fresh, others old and scarred over his skin is a text of its own.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 42 The walls of the room itself are covered in similar WRITI and SYMBOLS. Runes, hexes, spells and text have been carved or painted onto the walls. There are dozens of books and scrolls around the room. Religious and spiritua texts lie alongside books on witchcraft and sorcery.
(stunned) Your body...
Still your tongue! (to Kane) Forgive him Solomon, he is young.
(to the novice) Didn’t you know; I am a marked man? Thomas cannot help but stare.
Do they really... protect you from...
Mind who you name in this holy place, novice! A SHADOW falls across the open doorway. They turn to see the ABBOT. Both monks bow their heads as the Abbot enters the room.

Leave us. The monks hurry out as the Abbot closes the door behind them. He is an elderly man; stern and devout but not unkind. He scrutinizes the room, taking in the desecratio around him. He eyes Kane silently.
Once again we heard your cries at matins.
I didn’t mean to disturb your prayers. My dreams haunt me, even here.
You would do well to listen to what they tell you.

They tell me I am damned.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 13 The Abbot examines the books and texts on a table. He is not pleased by what he sees; a Bible with scribblings and notes over the text. Other books, clearly full of magic a pagan spells.
And yet you still defile our sacred text. And these others; such dark works.
They are just books Abbot.
If you believed words had no power you would never have corrupted your own flesh so. Men have been burned for less.
I am no heretic.

I know that my son but these are not times of tolerance. If someone were to ever find out that we harboured you there would be... questions. Kane climbs from the bed and gathers his papers together, returning them to his wooden chest and closing the lid.
Who would know? I live here in solitude; I have renounced violence; given up my power. Given my wealth to the church.
And we are grateful for all your gifts to us. (about the books) You don’t need this witchcraft to hide from evil; God protects his own.

But I am not one of God’s own am I? But how can I redeemed myself in His eyes, when I know the servants of darkness are searching for me? Kane falls silent. The Abbot sits.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 14
Solomon, these months you have been here, I have felt a shadow growing over us all. And when I prayed for guidance I (a beat) I do not see a way for you to remain. (a long pause) You must leave us.
Leave? No.
I am sorry.
Please Abbot, this is sanctuary. But Kane sees the resolve in the Abbot’s face.
Where can I go?
Go home.
No.
You are of noble birth; I know you have lands in the west.
No.
Solomon I...
I cannot return home.
Nor can you remain.

High winds sweep rain horizontally against the stone wall of the monastery as the GATES OPEN.  10 14 12 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 418 Kane is standing there. Long staff in his hand, hat pulle low and heavy wool cloak wrapped about him. Just a few bags of his personal possessions are slung over his shoulder. Several MONKS are by the gate. One of them hands him a small parcel of food. They watch silently and CROSS THEMSELVES as he steps over the threshold and into the unknown.
Watching from a high window, the ABBOT and the OLDER MONK see Kane set out.
Are you doing right by sending him back into the world?
My dreams said he must be sent from here. I listen to what I am told. The Abbot watches Kane stride away.
Can Kane bring anything but destruction and pain?
Perhaps that is what is needed in these darkening times. He wants redemption for his sins; there are many paths to God, not all of them peaceful.
KANE makes his way across the lonely hills and valleys of this desolate part of the country.

In driving rain, KANE passes by a TINY GROUP OF NEARLY DERELICT HOUSES. A MOTHER wails in distress as the FATHER digs GRAVES for several dead children wrapped in cloth at their feet. The mother watches Kane pass with dead eyes.
13 14 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 16

The DRIVING RAIN has eased. The landscape clothed in dank fog. It fills the hollows and clings to the rocks. The cold settles into Kane’s bones as he makes his way across open ground. From behind him, he hears the SOUND of a WAGON rattling towards him. He turns to see it emerge like a vast ghost through the fog. It’s a FAMILY driving their covered wago Kane steps out of their way to allow them to pass. The DRIVER nods and slows his wagon. A young BOY looks at Kane from the back of the wagon.
Can we offer you a ride pilgrim? These roads ahead should not be travelled alone.
My thanks friend but no.

As you wish. God be with you. The driver urges his horses onwards and soon he and his family are swallowed in the mist once again. Kane hefts his bags and settles into his stride, down the path. Up ahead the fog suddenly seems to darken as the tree lin of a FOREST comes into view.

Thicker fog in these trees now. The damp dripping from th branches and the cold clinging to Kane’s woollen cape. Th trees seem to press in on him. A flock of birds taking flight noisily sets him on edge. He comes to a fork in the path and stops to consider. A creaking in the trees leads him to look up and see FOUR HUMAN CORPSES swing from several branches in the trees. A hanging by nooses, some with their INNARDS DRAWN OUT. KANE chooses a path and presses on.
15 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett a7

Still in the depths of the ancient forest, KANE has set himself a small camp to the side of the track. A tiny fir is flickering, heating water as he chews some bread. A MOVEMENT AMONG THE TREES draws his attention, he sits u attentively but sees nothing. Then from behind him, A KNIFE IS PRESSED TO HIS THROAT.

Move and you die. Kane is forced to his feet by a heavy-set, SKINHEAD THIEF who whistles to his TWO COMPANIONS who are lurking in the undergrowth. One is heavily TATTOOED whilst the other is massively built with a HEAVY, BRAIDED BEARD. They are a feral and dangerous group and enjoying their brutal work.
I want no trouble. BEARD SMASHES Kane in the stomach with a heavy cudgel. Ka doubles and falls to the ground, coughing.

Too bad. You’ve already got it. They begin to search through his bags. There’s almost nothing of interest or value. BEARD empties Kane’s bag of scrolls and books. The few coins, some food and other ite are taken. The thieves are not happy.
He’s got nothing. You a priest?
A traveller.
Travelling where?
Nowhere. Just take what you want.
Don’t worry pilgrim, we will. Kane keeps his head down. TATTOO stares at the scrolls.
Look at these. I say he’s a sorcerer, See here; these is magical symbols.  16 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 18 Tattoo grabs Kane by the hair and drags him to the fire.

Should we burn you for a witch? Tattoo’s companions cheer him on as he pushes Kane’s face near to the flames. Kane does not fight but resists and n matter how hard Tattoo pushes he cannot make Kane move. Finally Kane yanks his head free and stares hard into Tattoo’s eyes. The thief flinches from the deadly look
There’s murder in your eyes traveller. Would you kill me?
No.
You won’t kill the men who steal from you?
I will not fight another man. SKINHEAD slaps Kane, sends him reeling back. Kane slowly climbs to his feet. The robbers laugh.
You worthless coward. Fight me.
I will not fight you. I have renounced violence.
We haven't. BEARD SMASHES KANE ACROSS THE HEAD with his wooden cudgel
You will do as I say boy! Through the darkness STERN MAN’S FACE swims into view through the smoke and mist of Kane’s memory. He looms dow onto Kane. This is his FATHER...

FOURTEEN YEAR OLD SOLOMON KANE is standing defiantly befo his father’s high chair at the head of the Great Hall of his castle home. Various SERVANTS and HANGERS-ON mill about but they are trying to avoid the conflict that is raging between father and son.  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 19
No! KANE’S FATHER You are the second son and Marcus is my heir. Your brother will be master of these lands on my death.
Marcus is a brute and... KANE’S FATHER (talking him down) ...And you, you will join the church as is tradition.

I do not wish to be a priest; I want to go to sea. KANE’S FATHER What you want is of no importance Solomon! I have arranged with Father Simnal for you to accompany him to the abbey. At his father’s signal, FATHER SIMNAL who has been sittin nearby, steps up and nods politely to Kane.

I have no interest in the church or its teachings. I will not go. KANE’S FATHER Then you will have nothing. I will cut you off. You will be a landless vagrant. Is that what you want? Kane turns from his father and storms out. KANE’S FATHER If you walk out now, you may never return. Do not defy me. His Father’s words are ringing in young Kane’s ears as he flings back the doors to the great hall. And there, suddenly, looming before him is the DEVIL’S REAPER - BURNING SWORD in hand. The Demon swings the blad and CUTS KANE DOWN even as Kane screams out in pain and fear...
17 18 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 20
KANE wakes with a sudden cry to find a YOUNG WOMAN leanin over him, concerned. Talking gently, soothing...
Be calm...be calm Sir. You are safe. (calling off) Father! Kane tries to speak but he’s delirious and confused. His face is bloodied and swollen; his body bruised and stiff.
Here...Take a little water. But Kane fades back into unconsciousness again. FADE TO BLACK.
You are safe here.

Beneath a threatening sky and with the imposing grandeur AXMOUTH CASTLE in the distance YOUNG KANE wanders the windswept sea cliffs away from his home. He has his travelling bags slung over his shoulder, clearly ready fo the road. The open ocean sweeps out in front to the distant horizon A few TALL SHIPS OF THE NAVY cruise past. Solomon watches them, envious as DISTANT SHOUTS from the crew drift to hi Then he hears a SUDDEN, SHARP SCREAM from nearby. He drop his bags and rushes round a corner to see a very tall, POWERFUL YOUNG MAN overpowering a PRETTY YOUNG GIRL. He’s tearing at her clothes, clearly trying to rape her KANE DRAWS A SHORT KNIFE from his belt and rushes forward grabbing the youth and pulling him back...
Stop! ...,only to halt, stunned, when the older youth turns on him.
Marcus...  Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 2a
(mocking) Little brother. I heard you had run away. Fleeing the life of a holy man.
Marcus, you must not do this. (to the girl) Sarah, are you hurt?
Solomon he was trying to... Marcus slaps the girl to silence.
Quiet! I gave you no permission to speak. (to Kane) This is not your concern, Solomon. Be on your way. Kane advances on Marcus and pulls Sarah from his grasp.
No! Let her go. Sarah, run. Go now! Sarah races away. Kane squares up to his brother. Marcus is immense in stature, far taller and more powerfully bui than his whip-thin younger brother
You shouldn’t get between a master and his pleasure.
Is that how it’s going to be when you are Lord here; nothing but greed and cruelty?
(about Kane’s knife) What were you going to do with that little toothpick?
Teach you some humility to accompany your power.

I don’t think you’re the one to teach me anything little brother Marcus, suddenly, grabs Kane’s arm, twists it hard and snatches the knife from him.  19 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 22 He presses it to his Kane’s throat, drawing a little bloo Whispering savagely in his brother’s ear.

I am the first-born; I am the heir and that means I am your master too. You will never be anything more than a coward, fleeing your duty. Take your bags and leave this land. Marcus pushes Kane away. In fury, Kane turns and shoves h brother back towards the cliff edge. Caught by surprise Marcus stumbles back and trips ona rock... ...With a cry he TOPPLES BACKWARDS, OVER THE EDGE OF THE CLIFF. Kane desperately reaches for Marcus’s flailing hand but cannot save him.

Brother!!! Save me! He falls... Kane scrambles to the edge only to see, fifty feet below, the SHATTERED BODY OF HIS BROTHER, still twitching, on th rocks below. His head has been crushed in, his jaw partly torn away. All Kane can see through the mask of blood on his brother destroyed face are his eyes, staring, furiously back at him.

This time Kane wakes in slow silence. No screaming, just muted sadness and pain as he opens his bleary eyes onto t wagon. A twelve year old boy, SAMUEL, is looking through some ba nearby. He is working silently and doesn’t notice Kane is awake and watching him.
Boy... Samuel turns and yells in fear and scrambles out of the wagon.

(yelling) He’s awake! Father! That man he’s awake!  20 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 23 Kane tries to right himself but hasn’t the energy. He groans in pain. The flaps of the wagon cover are drawn back. Faces are silhouetted against the daylight that pours in.
The young woman, MEREDITH, is holding Kane’s head as she puts a flask to his lips. He drinks. Finally finds his voice.

(faintly) Who...are you? The man by Meredith’s side is WILLIAM CROWTHORN. In his 50’s, he has an air solemn kindness and gentle good humou about him. He’s dressed in the simple, DARK CLOTHES OF A PURITAN, as are all his family. Meredith mops Kane’s brow.
(to her father) He is still fevered Father.

It has broken. He will be well. (to Kane) Sir, my name is William Crowthorn. This is my daughter Meredith. And you met, quite briefly, my son Samuel. My eldest, Edward, is driving this wagon and my wife Katherine is outside also. Samuel peers in nervously from outside.
Where are you taking me?
We prayed for you. Meredith has nursed you these past days. All of us have spent time at you side. Kane tries to rise again. He’s wounded and weak but fighting.
Where are you taking me?  21 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 24
There are many evils on this road but we are not among them. You are safe and on the road heading west to Plymouth.
Plymouth?
We’re bound for the New World. Kane studies the man for a moment
I know you. You offered me a ride.
I did.
I should have accepted.
True enough. You took quite some beating but in a few days, the Lord willing, you will be fit once more. (calling out) Edward, pull over now. We’1l make camp for the night.

The COVERED CART is driven by EDWARD, William’s eldest so and a serious young man in his mid 20’s. Though all the family are dressed as Puritans, only Edward wears the dog collar and garb of a PRIEST. Beside him on the bench is William’s wife, KATHERINE; a bright and homely woman in her 50’s. SAMUEL is walking besides the cart, swatting the long grass with a stick. EDWARD guides the cart to some open ground beside a cryst clear river. It is an idyllic spot in a picturesque valley.
22 23 Solomon Kane by Michael J. Bassett 28

MEREDITH and KATHERINE are gathering together cooking utensils and food stuff for the evening meal. WILLIAM and EDWARD are preparing a covered area for sleeping by the wagon. Young SAMUEL is exploring nearby.
Don’t stray too far Samuel.
Samuel; water the horses. (Samuel ignores him) Samuel!
